content.description:
Starts at the westernmost end of pulpit rock, underneath an overhang with a finger crack.

To reach the roof, you must climb a featured face with poor protection.

Climbed free to the roof but aid climbed the roof on nuts and hedges.
content.location:
On the western prow of Pulpit, under a prominent overhang near the top of the formation.

A featured face with adequate holds but sparse protection is halfway up the cliff. (I remember this as being lighter colored, perhaps because a large flake fell off)

content.description:
Start up the rib of red Tower Sandstone which makes it to the ground here.

A series of flakes and a short hand crack lead to the top.
content.location: Just left of the Bombay start variation.

climbs.name: South Face Bombay Variation
climbs.fa: Arlo Niederer, Larry Scritchfield, Mike Niksich 1970

content.description:
Starts in a flared, bombay squeeze slot formed because the Green River Shale formation eroded out from underneath the red Tower Sandstone.

After about 20-30 feet, traverse left into a crack and flake system.

If they are still there, Larry and I placed a piton and bolt to use as rappel anchors.Â  Not safe after 50 years.
content.protection: Climbed on nuts and hexes WAY before cams.
content.location: Look for a flared, bombay squeeze slot near the middle of the South face.

content.description:
While approaching from the West on the Ridgeline, you'll take the lightly worn trail that leads directly to the base of the wall. The obvious slabby crack runs up and to climbers left. About 70' up you'll see bolted chains as the the first anchor (3 bolts/chains as of August 2017). End of second pitch let's out to a 10' ledge where you can untie and walk to the summit about 100' east.

1 rope needed.
content.protection: Single rack of cams to 3inches. Single set of nuts. Few hexes up to 3" come in handy especially for P2. Lots of loose rock so this can be quite heady for the new trad leader. Bolted belays. Mixed protection.
content.location: Northwest face. Obious hand/offwidth crack. Follows this hand crack gully until first anchor. Then pitch two follows the crack feature up and right until a sloped ledge with a 2 bolt anchor about 90 ft up.
